thread.title: Senator's case suspended by ethics officer while police investigate: sources
thread.title_full: Senator's case suspended by ethics officer while police investigate: sources

author: CBC News
title: Senator's case suspended by ethics officer while police investigate: sources
text:
Don Meredith case suspended by ethics officer while police investigate: sources Teen alleged inappropriate affair with senator CBC News Posted: Oct 02, 2015 5:50 PM ET Last Updated: Oct 02, 2015 5:50 PM ET An investigation by the Senate ethics officer into allegations of sexual misconduct against Senator Don Meredith has been referred to the police, sources tell CBC News. (CBC) Related Stories 
Canada's federal ethics watchdog has suspended her investigation into allegations of sexual misconduct against Senator Don Meredith pending the outcome of an investigation by another authority. 
Sources tell CBC News the file has been handed over to the police. 
Meredith was ousted from the Conservative caucus following a report by the Toronto Star that an 18-year-old woman alleged she had an inappropriate sexual relationship with Meredith that began when she was 16. 
Senator Don Meredith referred to ethics officer after reports of affair with teen 
In a news release issued Friday afternoon, Lyse Ricard's office said the ethics officer "may suspend her review of a matter if it is under investigation by another authority and that authority requests that the review be suspended." 
Ricard, according to the news release, "is of the view that, in this case, it is in the public interest to comply with this request in order to avoid interfering with the other authority's ongoing investigation." 
"The Senate ethics officer has no further comments about this matter at this time." 
More to come
